name: Seaport Boston Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is very nice. I am not sure what people are all upset about on this site. You are unable to actually hear people going to the bathroom as one person stated. You can hear the pipes when someone flushes the toilet. There is a HUGE difference. This is not typical but I have heard it at other hotels as well. This hotel does have thin walls, but it was not horrible. The gym here is amazing. I would stay here again for the gym... fitness is very important to my daily routine. Its free and its amazing. The desk in the room is perfect for someone on business... the internet services is free and fast! This hotel is great... the room is starting to show some signs of age, but it is still great. I would suggest checking out LTK for dinner... its a block away and the food was great.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — Location outside of the downtown Boston

reviews.text: I have visited Seaport Hotel on many occaisions for business lunches and meetings, and have always been impressed with the service and attentiveness of the staff.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.text: When I had to spend an overnight in Boston, I did not hesitate to make my reservation at Seaport. I was pleased, but not surprised, to discover that the impeccable service I had grown so fond of at the bar and the restaurant extended to the entire hotel. From the doorman to the concierge to the staff at the fitness center, everyone was genuine and courteous. And the gracious woman at the giftshop was nothing but pleasant after I unknowingly had her stay open an extra 10 minutes as I purchased a few items that I had forgotten.
reviews.title: VERY disappointed

reviews.text: The fitness center was one of the nicest I have ever experienced and was a far cry from the 3-treadmill, outdated fitness centers I have seen at other hotels. And the locker room was just as impressive. I did not get to experience a spa-treatment, but it is certainly on my to-do list.
reviews.title: Good Hotel But Thin Walls/Floors

likes.disliked: — Very audible bathroom noises from the next room - Seaport should have insullated better

reviews.text: Another thing that shouldn't go unnoticed is the hotel's committment to being environmentally conscious. This includes encouraging guests to recycle and providing them with the means to do so as well as giving the option to reuse towels and linens- which is a conservation measure that really adds up. The subject of the environment is important to me, and I was thrilled when I saw the hotel's dedication to the environment.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: As a speaker with a meeting/event academy and exhibition, the planner who books sites and accommodations had sited and selected this property for the speakers hotel stays.
reviews.title: Loved the location and view....

likes.liked: — The location was perfect with a wonderful view in proximity to our meeting location at the Seaport Trade Center.

reviews.text: While there were industry posts regarding the noise level in the hotel, I was on the 16th floor facing the south and waterfront overlooking Boston Harbor and the Seaport Trade Center and some of the docks. The view from the room was beautiful, well appointed and had many surprise amenities such as single pod coffee makers that could brew Euro-style coffee or a traditional 8 oz. serving. There was even a scale in the bathroom!
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: The room was beautifully appointed with soothing decor, a very comfortable bed, complimentary wireless internet (and ethernet cords for wired laptops) along with television and a lovely Bose Wave Radio. Walking in upon check-in, the radio was playing and when they came in for turn-down service....it was turned on again.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable Hotel

likes.disliked: — Not close to areas with more activities e.g. restaurants, bars, shops, etc.

reviews.text: I loved the bathroom with the curved shower rod, meaning I didn't have to fight the clinging curtain from the traditional rod configuration. The "Green Concept" was also something that gave a good feeling over stewardship from water consumption, use of towels/linens and each room was also equipped with recycling bins with splits in the waste basket. They're also a LEEDS hotel so they're most energy efficient.
reviews.title: The Worst!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While there have been posts about the noise level in this hotel, I didn't experience any interference from rooms adjacent, or noise from the hallway.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

likes.liked: — Location, fitness center, quality of service

reviews.text: I was at first very excited about my stay at the Seaport Hotel, hoping it would be excellent. My first problem was stained sheets. I told my husband they looked as if they had been laundered, but the BROWN stain made me have doubts. The plug in the tub did not work properly, so no bubble bath. The AC in the room did not work well. Although the temperature read as if it were ok, it was very hot and I had trouble sleeping. This discussion came up from another person that I met while at a seminar there. They said the same thing about their room and suggested that I turn the fan on to run all night. This did help. The next night, I ordered a bottle of wine through room service. The cost was to be $28 plus taxes and delivery fee. I was charged $45. I called room service to go over the problem and got no resolution. I had to take the bottle downstairs along with the price list that was in the room. I did get partial credit but not a full credit. WHY? Is it really that hard to calculate? Charge what you post and don't false advertise. I called twice before arriving to double check that the room charge would be put on the corporate card and was told both times, yes, it would. Didn't happen, I had to use my personal card and get reimbursed from my company. The only thing that I enjoyed about my stay was the food. The food was excellent and maybe the best breakfast I ever had in my life. I will say that I did request that maintenance fix the plug in the tub. They did, and I was able to take a bath my second night there.
reviews.title: Stay at Seaport

reviews.text: We were in Boston for a meeting and decided to try something different from the usual big chains (Marriott, Westin, etc.), and were very pleasantly surprised by the Seaport. Great service, very comfortable beds, quiet, easy access to the convention center by a walkway, and just down the block from a terrific restaurant called Salvatore's. The T is just outside the hotel, making travel into the city very easy. We really appreciated the in-room fridge; exercise room and pool were really nice but didn't allow kids<16 (a real bummer since our daughter is an athlete and was counting on continuing her training during the vacation). Minor downsides: in-room coffee was awful, telephone receptionists were less than enthusiastic.
reviews.title: Wonderful little hotel

likes.disliked: — Didn't allow supervised child athlete age 14 into the exercise room/pool

reviews.text: First time in the hotel and it is a beauty. The hotel is an exceptionally well managed hotel where all employees go out of their way to make your stay nice. I stayed for 5 nights while on business and enjoyed every minute of it. Although it is off the beaten path a little downtown is an easy and pretty walk along the waterfront area. Don't make the mistake of relying on the close restaurants as many nicer restaurants are a short walk. The Legal Seafood place and old timer No Name Seafood are less than good so keep walking.
reviews.title: Exceptionally well run hotel !

likes.liked: — The friendly staff and no-tipping policy. Be aware that a daily gratuity (like on a cruise) is added in to the bill when you checkout.

reviews.text: Due to United Airlines' ineptitude (delays from Chicago to Boston), I missed a flight overseas from Boston and had to spend the night in Boston. The Travellers Aid desk at Logan Airport found a room for me for the night at the Seaport Hotel. It was a little more than I had hoped to pay, but due to the basketball tournament and conventions in town, I was happy to have a room.
reviews.title: A nice stay

likes.liked: — Super nice staff, clean and comfortable room

reviews.text: The Seaport is probably not a place I would have chosen on my own, but I liked it. I can't say enough about the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff - everyone from front desk to housekeeping. They were very accommodating to me when I was quite upset about missing the flight and gave me pointers on where to go, where to buy things, etc. They also let me check out late because I didn't get to the hotel until nearly midnight, which I thought was nice.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, well priced

likes.disliked: — Locaton is a little off the beaten path for a tourist.

reviews.title: Great hotel but a few disappointments
reviews.text: I am so disappointed to have to write this review. I love this hotel and its service inclusive policy and so much of what it tries to achieve. Unfortunately on my last trip here a number of things left a bad taste in the mouth.
Good points first of all
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: - no tipping
reviews.title: Excellent, comfortable, service-oriented hotel

reviews.text: - the best hotel gym I have ever been in (and I have seen a lot)
reviews.title: Much better than the Westin

reviews.text: - free internet in the room
reviews.title: very nice

likes.liked: — service included; nice room; free internet
likes.disliked: — too cold air conditioning in public areas

reviews.text: Good location, both for walking / public transport into the centre of Boston, but also for access to the airport.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.text: Hotel staff are all lovely, helpful and friendly. Free WiFi, nice comfortable rooms and coffee/tea-making machine in your room (perfect to get you out of the bed in the morning).
reviews.title: Nice hotel close to convention center

reviews.text: The "no tipping" philosophy is a godsend for foreign visitors such as myself - I can never work out how much to give and when I should/shouldn't tip (customs, and %s, being different in the UK), so this takes that hassle away without me under- or over-tipping people.
reviews.title: Great location. Excellent staff.

reviews.text: Plenty of great restaurants nearby too.
reviews.title: Consistently Great!

reviews.text: The Seaport is a very nice hotel if you are in town for a conference. Staff is friendly and rooms are great. If you are in town for pleasure, I would recommend staying closer to the heart of the city where everything is within walking distance.
reviews.title: Loved my stay at the Seaport
NiceHotel
reviews.text: I was in Boston to attend a conference. Seaport was only a short walk to the Boston Conference Center. The room was small but nice and clean. The staff was helpful but not really friendly. They weren't rude but not very enthuastic. The bellhops were the only ones who were friendly. The restaurant is expensive and I didn't care for the menu selections. But there are some restaurants that are within walking distance. The hotel is not located in an area where there are attractions. But you can catch a bus that will drop you off at Fanuil Hall. I also caught a tour bus that picks up in front of the hotel. The T is also across the street. The plumbing is quite loud but it didn't bother me. The wireless internet is a nice amenity. I enjoyed my stay and would visit this hotel again.

I was there for a convention at the World Trade Center. Hotel was doing some renovations to the public areas. Front desk staff was not very knowledgeable about the hours of restaurant. When I made my reservation I asked it they had smoking rooms available, the reservationist said they did. Get there I am forced to intial the registration card stating the $150.00 fee for smoking. Had I been told the truth when I made my reservation I would have stayed at another hotel. Room was very small, not very clean. There was toothpaste spit on the mirror in the bathroom. The bedspread had an overwhelming smell of cheap perfume, asked for a clean one never got it. $29.00 per day for parking, you would think hotels guests would get a cheaper rate for parking. Behind the hotel is a lot for $11.00 per day. I do not think I will ever stay at thishotel again nor will I reccomend it to anyone. Bythe way this is a NO TIP facility, so no wonder the staff do not go out of thier way to help you.
reviews.title: ok, I have stayed at better hotels

likes.liked: — The fresh flower arrangements in the hotel lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I went there for the wine expo, and found it a great place to stay. I immediately reccommended it to all my friends, even one coming in the summer to visit from Germany! We liked the small touches- the doorbell outside the room, the bathroom mirror that does not fog up, and the rug in the bathroom. Most hotels only give you a towel for the floor. The staff was courteous and informative at the desk, and even passing through the hallways. i loved the decor of the room, very up to date. the beds were actually quite comfortable, and we appreciated the small comfy chairs with side table to have our dinner in room. We actually walked the short distance to the 'no name restraunt' and brought it back to our room (the food was great), but we did order wine from room service, which was promptly delivered and enjoyed. it was a great stay and we were very happy. Wouldn't reccommend it though if you want to see a lot of boston sites just because it is not close to all the happenings, but it is very close to the T so you could get around.
reviews.title: wanted to stay there forever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed for two nights for the Wine Expo and this is the spot to stay for that event! We had views of the harbor anf the Pru my only complaint is that I don't care for innerspring matresses so I did not find the beds all that comfortable. But I am spoiled as I have a Natures rest latex core bed at home. Othwerwise the room was clean and comfortable. Room service was excellent and the staff simply awesome! I left my cord for my laptop there and I did not discover it until I got home. I was panicked as I needed to write a review of the Expo.I called the hotel who immediately retrieved it and mailed it back to me! No worries! Now that's service! Staff is wonderful. And there is no tipping. Really, they don't just say it. they mean it! They make you feel comfortable about it. So the cost of the hotel winds up being reasonable and a bargain for Boston. As for location the "T" is right there and you can get anywhere for about $10-12 for a cab. I went to the North end for dinner and to The Hungry I for less than ten dollars.
reviews.title: Boston Wine Expo
Good for Conference Stay
reviews.text: This was our 2nd stay at the Seaport. Previously stayed there in 2006.

reviews.title: Seaport Hotel Rocks!!!
reviews.text: As always, the Seaport Hotel did not disappoint. I was in town early in the morning for a meeting and they offered me an 8:30am check-in to my room, talk about good service!!! Not only did I get an early check-in, but I did not have to ask for it.
The Room is 4-5 star quality, bed is of top notch comfort and the high end breakfast at the Auro Rest. is a must visit, expensive but the food is all-star - not the usual breakfast buffett!
reviews.title: Seaport # 1

reviews.text: High recommend this hotel, everything about it is great!!
reviews.title: A good business trip
Good oasis.
reviews.text: Attended a wedding here and i am a local Bostonian so I can speak from first hand knowledge. The Seaport is first class and the customer service is outstanding. The wedding staff and servers were the best of all, always attentive but not overbearing!
hope the management appreciates them, especially David. Rooms are very good, loved the view of the waterfront. Customer service started at the door and we had a great time!
reviews.title: Loved the Seaport Hotel!!

likes.liked: — It was really clean and the rooms were huge, for a downtown hotel in Boston.

reviews.text: I recently stayed here to attend a conference at the trade center next door. The main attraction of this hotel is that it is connected to the center via a sky bridge, it's also about 10 minutes from the airport by cab or water taxi. There are several nice restaurants within walking distance including the Legal Test Kitchen which we hit for drinks/appetizers one night.
reviews.title: Great for conferences, airport accessibility

likes.liked: — Location near the world trade center

reviews.text: The hotel is your basic 4 star business hotel. The beds were comfy, there was a good selection of TV channels, and the staff was nice and helpful. The lack of an in-room mini-bar was surprising. Wireless Internet access was superb, though cost $10 a day through T-Mobile.
reviews.title: Decent, nothing great

likes.liked: — Location, but for our purposes only.
likes.disliked: — Price, it didn't seem like it was worth the amount we were paying

reviews.text: On the downside, there is a lot of construction in the lobby as they conduct renovations to the main restaurant. The health club isn't just for hotel guests but rather is a public fitness center. It's small and crowded, but well equipped. When I went down at 7:00 AM to work out, every aerobic machine was in use. They also charge $2.00 for a bottle of water. The pool looked nice, and they have fitness classes and personal instructors available.
reviews.title: Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd stay here again for an event at the hotel or the trade center, but not for any other reason.
reviews.title: Didn't Want to Leave
A Little High In Price But Worth It!
reviews.text: My wife, 2 1/2 yr old daughter and I stayed at the Seaport the weekend prior to the Boston Marathon. The Hotel is is fair amount away from the main downtown area, and not really walking distance to very much. We knew that going in, as our plan was to go the Children's Museum and the Aquarium which were both relatively close. For our purposes, the hotel was in perfect location, but for someone looking for more of a touristy trip, I would advise against that location. The hotel itself was very nice looking, with a very friendly and helpful staff. The room was nothing more than average, and we had a great deal of trouble obtaining a comfortable room temperature. It was also quite pricey, but that may have been due to it being a busy weekend because of the marathon. I would only stay there again if we were doing the same trip to the museum and aquarium, but would still look into a less expensive alternative in the area. Also, be prepared to pay an arm and a leg for parking. We paid $29 for one night in the hotel garage, $24 for a couple hours at the Prudential Building lot, and a whopping $39 for 3 hours in the garage next to the Aquarium.

reviews.title: Great place for the family
reviews.text: Saw the boats on the harbor, had lunch on the waterfront and came back to the hotel for a nice family swim. Room service featured banana splits for the kids. We can't wait to return!

reviews.title: Wonderful Weekend Escape!
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a getaway from the kids and absolutely loved our experience. The room was beautifully appointed and spacious. The staff was very courteous and helpful. We enjoyed using the fitness center and the proximity to the waterfront. As the seaport district continues to grow, this hotel will become a must for visitors to Boston.
My family stayed at the Seaport for a family wedding. The service was wonderful, the rooms very clean and the food great. Given the opportunity, my family will again choose the Seaport.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel
Good Hotel near the convention center
reviews.text: I stayed here for a convention and found the hotel to be very nice, with all the basic amenities that you would want. View and location is nice, very close and convenient to the airport and a 5 minute walk away from the convention center. Not a ton to do around the hotel, but being close to the water is definitely a plus. 24 hr room service was of good quality with huge portion sizes.

reviews.title: Great location and service
reviews.text: Staff was polite and professional.

this place absolutely sucks. The rooms are paper thin, you know who has gas next door, or when they have to get up and go to the bathroom in the middle of the night. What a disapointment for the very high $ they charge.
reviews.title: Hate this place

reviews.text: Stayed here for a wedding, booked 2 rooms next to each other as the price was reasonable and we had a little one with us, it worked beautifully!
reviews.title: Comfortable and well located

reviews.text: Service was excellent
reviews.title: happily surprised

reviews.text: Just an overall great experience!
reviews.title: Overall, a pleasant experience.

likes.disliked: — No complementary breakfast, proximity to center of town.

reviews.text: The walls ARE too thin, but the rest of the hotel was very nice.
reviews.title: Wonderful Staff But Thin Walls and Physical Problems

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel the weekend of July 4th for a wedding. Seaport Hotel has beat all my expectations and I have stayed in hotels/resorts in Florida, NY/NJ, NC and California. Seaport definitely beat them all.
reviews.title: Love, Love, Love Seaport Hotel

reviews.text: The customer service was exceptional. The people that worked their greeted us warmly. They were available to us to help even when we didn't realize we needed help :) without being overbearing.
reviews.title: Super customer service!

reviews.text: The food at the restaurant downstairs was fabulous, we had a family breakfast buffet one morning and and some friends and I had breakfast the next morning. The food tasted great, was fresh and the price was excellent.
reviews.title: Nice - but, too pricey.

likes.liked: — Really comfortable room/bed, great staff, clean property.
likes.disliked: — Room rates were a bit high.

reviews.text: The facilities was spotless. The view from our room was gorgeous.
reviews.title: Loved the location

reviews.text: For the day of the wedding the wedding coordinator was available to us and so helpful and kind. They provided steamers and help with them when we needed.
reviews.title: Don't stay at the Seaport Hotel - OVERRATED

reviews.text: I just returned from my 4th stay at the Seaport. As expected, it was a great experience. The location is perfect for me ... an easy trip on the Silver line from the airport and convenient to the metro. The hotel is tasteful and the rooms are contemporary, clean and well equipped. The beds are great and the showers are nice.
reviews.title: Another great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of course, human interaction is important and I always feel that the people that work at the hotel are actually happy I'm there with them.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!! The staff was extremely friendly, hotel was beautiful, our room was great and overall location you can't beat! I was very impressed and would recommend this to anyone staying in Boston. Tamo was a great spot to eat dinner and grab drinks for a Bruins game. The bar was packed and it would seem like everyone there was your good buddy watching the game- exciting!!! I can't wait to stay there again!!!
reviews.title: Business Meeting

reviews.text: 2013 marked the 11th year our company has held its annual 3-4 day meeting at the Seaport Hotel and World Trade Center. The 2013 was no exception to past experiences where we received first class, exceptional service delivered by every member of Seaport’s staff. Each year we learn a bit more to make the next year easier to manage, but could not do it without the excellent support the Seaport team offers us.
reviews.title: reservations

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this property to any meeting planner seeking a property that provides outstanding service from the sales team to the doorman. One step onto the property and anyone can see that Seaport employees are happy in their jobs and are always ready to help. The property is beautiful and in a “happening” and growing part of Boston.
reviews.title: Wedding Weekend

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Seaport Hotel for a 3 day conference at the World Trade Center. The hotel has a very 80´s decor, sort of "marine classic theme" using light blue and green hues. The rooms are ample with a big screen TV, nice amenities in the bathrooms, comfy bed and very, very clean.The area is off-the-Boston-action with only the World trade Center and a couple of good restaurants (Legal Harborside and Salvatore´s), but there are many transportation options (cheap and very cheap) to take you to Copley and Harvard Square and downtown Boston areas, that are more varied (and fun). So the location works only if you are attending a event at the WTC. We got a 259$/night rate and at this price point, I think it has a very good value proposition, specially comparing to neighbors Renaissance and Intercontinental (that soars around 380$/night)
reviews.title: Classic Near Boston World Trade Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good: rooms, free wifi with strong signal, friendly staff and concierge. Food at the bar was very good
reviews.title: Great hotel, steps from the convention center, but pricey.

reviews.text: The not-so-good: Buffet breakfast is tasteless and boring
reviews.title: Pretty typical upscale hotel but very expensive
Excellent service. Great family hotel
reviews.text: The bad: no room service after 10 or 11 pm(not sure), but when I returned to the hotel after a show the only option was a 7-11 across the street.(Bleahhh)

This hotel is beautiful inside and out. Staff were very friendly and helpful, allowing us to check in early. Our room was a decent size for a downtown hotel. Bed was very comfortable, linens and pillows as well. Bathroom very clean and nice.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a weeklong family vacation in Boston
New, Clean and Comfortable for a Great Price
reviews.text: We stayed with our extended family over a weekend. Because the hotel is on the newly-developed South Waterfront area, everything is new. There a great views of the harbor from a short walk across the street, and there are new restaurants and shop all around. The hotel staff were very friendly and strictly enforced the no tipping policy, despite my several efforts to tip various staff. Some places have such policies but they are not really in force. Here it was. That made the overall experience friendlier, with less "tension." The large lobby is open and welcoming, with plenty of comfortable high-back chairs. The rooms are comfortable and open, with large flat screen TVs and Keurig coffee makers. Hurray for the ability to make a decent single cup of coffee without having to go out or order room service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only down side to the hotel and this area is that it is separated by the river from the rest of the city. You definitely to take a cab or the silver line bus to get to the T system and other interesting areas. But this hotel is newer, nicer and a mch better value than most Boston hotels. We would definitely return here.
reviews.title: Great location and price

reviews.text: We stayed there for our one year anniversary and the location was great. It was about a mile and a half from Boston Common and Little Italy. Did not really have to take the subway except to go to the Sam Adams brewery. Located right next to a bunch of great restaurants too.
reviews.title: Allergy friendly and super clean rooms...a dream come true!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also provided a great view of both Boston and the harbor. The staff could not be friendlier or more helpful and the concierge was super helpful. All this for a pretty good price. The only thing is typically gratuity is included in everything which worked for us but may not appeal to everyone.
reviews.title: Perfect location!

reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised to learn upon checkin that I was placed on the allergy friendly floor. This is something I would always request if I knew such things existed! The first thing. Noticed was how clean and odor free the room was. I then saw a sign outlining the cleaning procedures for the room. Why don't all hotels explain this? Knowing all bed linens had been washed in scalding water prior to my arrival prevented my normal habit of tossing the bed quilt into the corner and treating it like hazardous material! :)
reviews.title: View of the tall ships

description: Located in Boston's bustling Seaport District with dozens of Boston's most popular restaurants and attractions within walking distance, the Seaport Hotel Boston offers business and leisure travelers a variety of upscale amenities including complimentary wireless Internet access, one of Boston's most luxurious fitness facilities, an indoor pool, complimentary bicycles and beautiful city and harbor views. Seaport Boston is proud to be one of the Boston's greenest hotels. The hotel is five minutes from Logan Airport by taxi, water taxi and the MBTA and offers weekday shuttle service into downtown Boston. Nearby attractions include the Boston Convention & Exhibition Center, the Institute for Contemporary Art, the Boston Children's Museum, Boston's pedestrian friendly Harborwalk and the Bank of America Music Pavilion.
